Title: Toyin Abraham’s ‘Oversabi Aunty’ hits ₦711.5m in 18 days
Summary: Toyin Abraham’s ‘Oversabi Aunty’ hits ₦711.5m in 18 days at the box office . The film is the fourth highest-grossing Nollywood film of all time in West Africa .

Title: Tax reform risks sluggish, uncertain execution timelines over tardy NSW
Summary: Tax reform risks sluggish, uncertain execution timelines over tardy NSW . Despite the swift transition of the Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) to the Nigeria Revenue Service, reflecting reflects a tardy transition .

Title: Nigeria’s escalating insecurity and looming hunger catastrophe
Summary: The latest alert by the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) warns that 35 million Nigerians could fall into severe hunger during the winter . 35 million people could be affected by severe hunger, the agency says .

Title: Dangote Refinery dismisses shutdown claims, says 50m litres of PMS produced daily
Summary: Dangote Petroleum Refinery has dismissed reports circulating in the media suggesting that it is shutting down operations for maintenance . The refinery says 50m litres of PMS is produced daily .

Title: APC draws battle line with Wike over Rivers political control
Summary: All Progressives Congress has moved to curb FCT minister Nyesom Wike, warning that his actions in Rivers State threaten party unity . Wike's actions threaten the party unity, says the party .

Title: Replacement of FIRS with NRS will overhaul revenue administration – Zacch Adedeji
Summary: Nigeria Revenue Service says its replacement with the defunct Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) will overhaul the architecture of the country's revenue administration . The replacement of FIRS with NRS will overhaul revenue administration – Zacch Adedeji .

Title: UK to seize illegal migrants’ phones under new counter terror policy
Summary: UK to seize illegal migrants’ phones under new counter terror policy . UK government has activated a counter-terror policy that allows it to seize mobile phones from illegal migrants .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, January 6, 2026
Summary: The Nigerian Naira maintained a relatively steady position against the United States Dollar during the early trading hours of Tuesday, January 6, 2026, across both the official and informal foreign exchange markets .

Title: How GenCos’ $6trn debt, state electricity markets dominated 2025
Summary: Nigerian Electricity Supply Industry (NESI) shaped by two defining developments: mounting N6 trillion debt owed by the Federal Government to power generation companies . •$10bn annual investment required to revive sector, Azura MD says .

Title: GNI reassures public on business continuity
Summary: Great Nigeria Insurance Plc has assured the general public that the fire incident did not affect its operations in anyway . The company stated that it does not maintain any office in the burnt building, nor does it conduct any operations whatsoever therein .

Title: [ICYMI] Nigeria emerges fifth-best English-speaking country in Africa
Summary: The 2025 Education First English Proficiency Index assessed English skills across 123 countries and regions, using data from 2.2 million test takers . Nigeria trails South Africa, Zimbabwe, Kenya, and Zambia, which lead in English proficiency . The rankings underscore the growing importance of English as a bridge for international communication, education, and commerce .

Title: [ICYMI] AFCON 2025: Super Eagles thrash Mozambique 4-0 to reach quarter-finals
Summary: Nigeria beat Mozambique 4-0 in their Round of 16 clash in Fès . The Super Eagles advance to the AFCON 2025 quarter-finals with the win . They will face the winners of the match between Algeria and Congo DR .

Title: Aviation professionals outline paths to sector recovery
Summary: Professionals from different disciplines in the aviation industry have suggested various ways to ease the pains and ensure progress in the sector over the next 12 months . Title: Pro-democracy group  to foster citizen-govt engagement
Summary: A socio-political group, Partners for Democratic Advancement, has restated its commitment to fostering citizen–government engagement . This was made known as the group announced the appointment of Prof. Lanre Aladeitan as its pioneer National Coordinator . The group said in a Monday statement that it is committed to promoting civic engagement and constructive support for

Title: APC chair condemns Niger killings, commends Tinubu's directives
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has ordered a manhunt for the terrorists responsible for the deadly attack . More than 40 people were killed in the Kasuwan Daji attack in Agwara and Borgu local government areas of Niger State . The attacks were reported as 'barbaric, inhumane, and utterly unacceptable'
